character_set_client.name: character_set_client
character_set_client.info: The character set in which statements are sent by the client

character_set_connection.name: character_set_connection
character_set_connection.info: The character set which should be translated to after receiving the statement

character_set_database.name: character_set_database
character_set_database.info: The character set of the default database

character_set_results.name: character_set_results
character_set_results.info: The character set which server should translate to before shipping result sets or error message back to the client

character_set_system.name: character_set_system
character_set_system.info: The character set used by the server for storing identifiers.

collation_connection.name: collation_connection
collation_connection.info: The collation which the server should translate to after receiving the statement

collation_database.name: collation_database
collation_database.info: The collation of the default database

interactive_timeout.name: interactive_timeout
interactive_timeout.info: The number of seconds the server waits for activity on an interactive connection before closing it.

max_allowed_packet.name: max_allowed_packet
max_allowed_packet.info: Max packet length to send to or receive from the server

tx_isolation.name: tx_isolation
tx_isolation.info: Transaction Isolcation Levels: READ-UNCOMMITTED READ-COMMITTED REPEATABLE-READ SERIALIZABLE

wait_timeout.name: wait_timeout
wait_timeout.info: The number of seconds the server waits for activity on a noninteractive connection before closing it.

explicit_defaults_for_timestamp.name: explicit_defaults_for_timestamp
explicit_defaults_for_timestamp.info: whether use traditional mode for timestamp

identity.name: identity
identity.info: This variable is a synonym for the last_insert_id variable. It exists for compatibility with other database systems.

lower_case_table_names.name: lower_case_table_names
lower_case_table_names.info: how table database names are stored and compared, 0 means stored using the lettercase in the CREATE_TABLE or CREATE_DATABASE statement. Name comparisons are case sensitive; 1 means that table and database names are stored in lowercase abd name comparisons are not case sensitive.

net_buffer_length.name: net_buffer_length
net_buffer_length.info: Buffer length for TCP/IP and socket communication

query_cache_size.name: query_cache_size
query_cache_size.info: The memory allocated to store results from old queries(not used yet)

query_cache_type.name: query_cache_type
query_cache_type.info: OFF = Do not cache or retrieve results. ON = Cache all results except SELECT SQL_NO_CACHE ... queries. DEMAND = Cache only SELECT SQL_CACHE ... queries(not used yet)

max_sp_recursion_depth.name: max_sp_recursion_depth
max_sp_recursion_depth.info: The number of times that any given stored procedure may be called recursively.

server_id.name: server_id
server_id.info: This variable specifies the server ID(not used yet, only sys var compatible)

session_track_schema.name: session_track_schema
session_track_schema.info: specifies whether return schema change info in ok packet
session_track_schema.info_cn: 控制返回的ok包中是否包含schema变更的信息

session_track_system_variables.name: session_track_system_variables
session_track_system_variables.info: specifies whether return system variables change info in ok packet
session_track_system_variables.info_cn: 控制返回的ok包中是否包含系统变量变更的信息

session_track_state_change.name: session_track_state_change
session_track_state_change.info: specifies whether return session state change info in ok packet
session_track_state_change.info_cn: 控制返回的ok包中是否包含session状态变更的信息

have_query_cache.name: have_query_cache
have_query_cache.info: Whether to have query cache or not(not used yet, only compatible)

query_cache_limit.name: query_cache_limit
query_cache_limit.info: The maximum query result set that can be cached by the query cache(not used yet, only sys var compatible)

query_cache_min_res_unit.name: query_cache_min_res_unit
query_cache_min_res_unit.info: The smallest unit of memory allocated by the query cache(not used yet, only sys var compatible)

query_cache_wlock_invalidate.name: query_cache_wlock_invalidate
query_cache_wlock_invalidate.info: query cache wirte lock for MyISAM engine (not used yet, only sys var compatible)

binlog_format.name: binlog_format
binlog_format.info: set the binary logging format(not used yet, only sys var compatible)

binlog_checksum.name: binlog_checksum
binlog_checksum.info: this variable causes the source to write a checksum for each event in the binary log(not used yet, only sys var compatible)

binlog_rows_query_log_events.name: binlog_rows_query_log_events
binlog_rows_query_log_events.info: This system variable affects row-based logging only(not used yet, only sys var compatible)

log_bin.name: log_bin
log_bin.info: This variable reports only on the status of binary logging(not used yet, only sys var compatible)

default_storage_engine.name: default_storage_engine
default_storage_engine.info: The default storage engine of OceanBase

cte_max_recursion_depth.name: cte_max_recursion_depth
cte_max_recursion_depth.info: Abort a recursive common table expression if it does more than this number of iterations.

regexp_stack_limit.name: regexp_stack_limit
regexp_stack_limit.info: The maximum available memory in bytes for the internal stack used for regular expression matching operations

regexp_time_limit.name: regexp_time_limit
regexp_time_limit.info: The time limit for regular expression matching operations, default unit is milliseconds

ob_interm_result_mem_limit.name: ob_interm_result_mem_limit
ob_interm_result_mem_limit.info: Indicate how many bytes the interm result manager can alloc most for this tenant

ob_proxy_partition_hit.name: ob_proxy_partition_hit
ob_proxy_partition_hit.info: Indicate whether sql stmt hit right partition, readonly to user, modify by ob

ob_trx_timeout.name: ob_trx_timeout
ob_trx_timeout.info: The max duration of one transaction

ob_enable_plan_cache.name: ob_enable_plan_cache
ob_enable_plan_cache.info: whether use plan cache in session

ob_enable_index_direct_select.name: ob_enable_index_direct_select
ob_enable_index_direct_select.info: whether can select from index table

ob_proxy_set_trx_executed.name: ob_proxy_set_trx_executed
ob_proxy_set_trx_executed.info: this value is true if we have executed set transaction stmt, until a transaction commit(explicit or implicit) successfully

ob_enable_aggregation_pushdown.name: ob_enable_aggregation_pushdown
ob_enable_aggregation_pushdown.info: enable aggregation function to be push-downed through exchange nodes

ob_proxy_global_variables_version.name: ob_proxy_global_variables_version
ob_proxy_global_variables_version.info: this value is global variables last modified time when server session create, used for proxy to judge whether global vars has changed between two server session

ob_proxy_user_privilege.name: ob_proxy_user_privilege
ob_proxy_user_privilege.info: Indicate current client session user privilege, readonly after modified by first observer

ob_org_cluster_id.name: ob_org_cluster_id
ob_org_cluster_id.info: When the DRC system copies data into the target cluster, it needs to be set to the CLUSTER_ID that should be written into commit log of OceanBase, in order to avoid loop replication of data. Normally, it does not need to be set, and OceanBase will use the default value, which is the CLUSTER_ID of current cluster of OceanBase. 0 indicates it is not set, please do not set it to 0

ob_plan_cache_percentage.name: ob_plan_cache_percentage
ob_plan_cache_percentage.info: percentage of tenant memory resources that can be used by plan cache

ob_plan_cache_evict_high_percentage.name: ob_plan_cache_evict_high_percentage
ob_plan_cache_evict_high_percentage.info: memory usage percentage of plan_cache_limit at which plan cache eviction will be trigger

ob_plan_cache_evict_low_percentage.name: ob_plan_cache_evict_low_percentage
ob_plan_cache_evict_low_percentage.info: memory usage percentage  of plan_cache_limit at which plan cache eviction will be stopped

recyclebin.name: recyclebin
recyclebin.info: When the recycle bin is enabled, dropped tables and their dependent objects are placed in the recycle bin. When the recycle bin is disabled, dropped tables and their dependent objects are not placed in the recycle bin; they are just dropped.

ob_capability_flag.name: ob_capability_flag
ob_capability_flag.info: Indicate features that observer supports, readonly after modified by first observer

is_result_accurate.name: is_result_accurate
is_result_accurate.info: when query is with topk hint, is_result_accurate indicates whether the result is acuurate or not

error_on_overlap_time.name: error_on_overlap_time
error_on_overlap_time.info: The variable determines how OceanBase should handle an ambiguous boundary datetime value a case in which it is not clear whether the datetime is in standard or daylight saving time

ob_compatibility_mode.name: ob_compatibility_mode
ob_compatibility_mode.info: What DBMS is OceanBase compatible with? MYSQL means it behaves like MySQL while ORACLE means it behaves like Oracle.

ob_sql_work_area_percentage.name: ob_sql_work_area_percentage
ob_sql_work_area_percentage.info: The percentage limitation of tenant memory for SQL execution.

ob_safe_weak_read_snapshot.name: ob_safe_weak_read_snapshot
ob_safe_weak_read_snapshot.info: The safe weak read snapshot version in one server

ob_route_policy.name: ob_route_policy
ob_route_policy.info: the routing policy of obproxy/java client and observer internal retry, 1=READONLY_ZONE_FIRST, 2=ONLY_READONLY_ZONE, 3=UNMERGE_ZONE_FIRST, 4=UNMERGE_FOLLOWER_FIRST, 5=FORCE_READONLY_ZONE

ob_enable_transmission_checksum.name: ob_enable_transmission_checksum
ob_enable_transmission_checksum.info: whether do the checksum of the packet between the client and the server

foreign_key_checks.name: foreign_key_checks
foreign_key_checks.info: set to 1 (the default by MySQL), foreign key constraints are checked. If set to 0, foreign key constraints are ignored

ob_statement_trace_id.name: ob_statement_trace_id
ob_statement_trace_id.info: the trace id of current executing statement

ob_enable_truncate_flashback.name: ob_enable_truncate_flashback
ob_enable_truncate_flashback.info: Enable the flashback of table truncation.

ob_tcp_invited_nodes.name: ob_tcp_invited_nodes
ob_tcp_invited_nodes.info: ip white list for tenant, support % and _ and multi ip(separated by commas), support ip match and wild match

sql_throttle_current_priority.name: sql_throttle_current_priority
sql_throttle_current_priority.info: current priority used for SQL throttling

sql_throttle_priority.name: sql_throttle_priority
sql_throttle_priority.info: sql throttle priority, query may not be allowed to execute if its priority isnt greater than this value.

sql_throttle_rt.name: sql_throttle_rt
sql_throttle_rt.info: query may not be allowed to execute if its rt isnt less than this value.

sql_throttle_cpu.name: sql_throttle_cpu
sql_throttle_cpu.info: query may not be allowed to execute if its CPU usage isnt less than this value.

sql_throttle_io.name: sql_throttle_io
sql_throttle_io.info: query may not be allowed to execute if its number of IOs isnt less than this value.

sql_throttle_network.name: sql_throttle_network
sql_throttle_network.info: query may not be allowed to execute if its network usage isnt less than this value.

sql_throttle_logical_reads.name: sql_throttle_logical_reads
sql_throttle_logical_reads.info: query may not be allowed to execute if its number of logical reads isnt less than this value.

ob_enable_jit.name: ob_enable_jit
ob_enable_jit.info: JIT execution engine mode, default is AUTO

ob_temp_tablespace_size_percentage.name: ob_temp_tablespace_size_percentage
ob_temp_tablespace_size_percentage.info: the percentage limitation of some temp tablespace size in tenant disk.

plugin_dir.name: plugin_dir
plugin_dir.info: the dir to place plugin dll

ob_sql_audit_percentage.name: ob_sql_audit_percentage
ob_sql_audit_percentage.info: The limited percentage of tenant memory for sql audit

ob_enable_sql_audit.name: ob_enable_sql_audit
ob_enable_sql_audit.info: wether use sql audit in session

optimizer_capture_sql_plan_baselines.name: optimizer_capture_sql_plan_baselines
optimizer_capture_sql_plan_baselines.info: optimizer_capture_sql_plan_baselines enables or disables automitic capture plan baseline.

parallel_servers_target.name: parallel_servers_target
parallel_servers_target.info: number of threads allowed to run parallel statements before statement queuing will be used.

ob_early_lock_release.name: ob_early_lock_release
ob_early_lock_release.info: If set true, transaction open the elr optimization.

ob_trx_idle_timeout.name: ob_trx_idle_timeout
ob_trx_idle_timeout.info: The stmt interval timeout of transaction(us)

block_encryption_mode.name: block_encryption_mode
block_encryption_mode.info: specifies the encryption algorithm used in the functions aes_encrypt and aes_decrypt

nls_date_format.name: nls_date_format
nls_date_format.info: specifies the default date format to use with the TO_CHAR and TO_DATE functions, (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS) is Common value

nls_timestamp_format.name: nls_timestamp_format
nls_timestamp_format.info: specifies the default date format to use with the TO_CHAR and TO_TIMESTAMP functions, (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS.FF) is Common value

nls_timestamp_tz_format.name: nls_timestamp_tz_format
nls_timestamp_tz_format.info: specifies the default timestamp with time zone format to use with the TO_CHAR and TO_TIMESTAMP_TZ functions, (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS.FF TZR TZD) is common value

ob_reserved_meta_memory_percentage.name: ob_reserved_meta_memory_percentage
ob_reserved_meta_memory_percentage.info: percentage of tenant memory resources that can be used by tenant meta data

ob_check_sys_variable.name: ob_check_sys_variable
ob_check_sys_variable.info: If set true, sql will update sys variable while schema version changed.

nls_language.name: nls_language
nls_language.info: specifies the default language of the database, used for messages, day and month names, the default sorting mechanism, the default values of NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE and NLS_SORT.

nls_territory.name: nls_territory
nls_territory.info: specifies the name of the territory whose conventions are to be followed for day and week numbering, establishes the default date format, the default decimal character and group separator, and the default ISO and local currency symbols.

nls_sort.name: nls_sort
nls_sort.info: specifies the collating sequence for character value comparison in various SQL operators and clauses.

nls_comp.name: nls_comp
nls_comp.info: specifies the collation behavior of the database session. value can be BINARY | LINGUISTIC | ANSI

nls_characterset.name: nls_characterset
nls_characterset.info: specifies the default characterset of the database, This parameter defines the encoding of the data in the CHAR, VARCHAR2, LONG and CLOB columns of a table.
nls_characterset.flags: GLOBAL | NEED_SERIALIZE | ORACLE_ONLY | INFLUENCE_PLAN | WITH_CREATE | READONLY

nls_nchar_characterset.name: nls_nchar_characterset
nls_nchar_characterset.info: specifies the default characterset of the database, This parameter defines the encoding of the data in the NCHAR, NVARCHAR2 and NCLOB columns of a table.

nls_date_language.name: nls_date_language
nls_date_language.info: specifies the language to use for the spelling of day and month names and date abbreviations (a.m., p.m., AD, BC) returned by the TO_DATE and TO_CHAR functions.

nls_length_semantics.name: nls_length_semantics
nls_length_semantics.info: specifies the default length semantics to use for VARCHAR2 and CHAR table columns, user-defined object attributes, and PL/SQL variables in database objects created in the session. SYS user use BYTE intead of NLS_LENGTH_SEMANTICS.

nls_nchar_conv_excp.name: nls_nchar_conv_excp
nls_nchar_conv_excp.info: determines whether an error is reported when there is data loss during an implicit or explicit character type conversion between NCHAR/NVARCHAR2 and CHAR/VARCHAR2.

nls_calendar.name: nls_calendar
nls_calendar.info: specifies which calendar system Oracle uses.

nls_numeric_characters.name: nls_numeric_characters
nls_numeric_characters.info: specifies the characters to use as the decimal character and group separator, overrides those characters defined implicitly by NLS_TERRITORY.

_nlj_batching_enabled.name: _nlj_batching_enabled
_nlj_batching_enabled.info: enable batching of the RHS IO in NLJ
_nlj_batching_enabled.flags: GLOBAL | SESSION | QUERY_SENSITIVE| NEED_SERIALIZE | INVISIBLE | INFLUENCE_PLAN

_groupby_nopushdown_cut_ratio.name: _groupby_nopushdown_cut_ratio
_groupby_nopushdown_cut_ratio.info: ratio used to decide whether push down should be done in distribtued query optimization.

_px_broadcast_fudge_factor.name: _px_broadcast_fudge_factor
_px_broadcast_fudge_factor.info: set the tq broadcasting fudge factor percentage.

transaction_isolation.name: transaction_isolation
transaction_isolation.info: Transaction Isolcation Levels: READ-UNCOMMITTED READ-COMMITTED REPEATABLE-READ SERIALIZABLE

ob_trx_lock_timeout.name: ob_trx_lock_timeout
ob_trx_lock_timeout.info: the max duration of waiting on row lock of one transaction

_ob_ols_policy_session_labels.name: _ob_ols_policy_session_labels
_ob_ols_policy_session_labels.info: store all session labels for all label security policy.

_px_partition_scan_threshold.name: _px_partition_scan_threshold
_px_partition_scan_threshold.info: least number of partitions per slave to start partition-based scan

_ob_px_slave_mapping_threshold.name: _ob_px_slave_mapping_threshold
_ob_px_slave_mapping_threshold.info: percentage threshold to use slave mapping plan

_enable_parallel_dml.name: _enable_parallel_dml
_enable_parallel_dml.info: A DML statement can be parallelized only if you have explicitly enabled parallel DML in the session or in the SQL statement.

_px_min_granules_per_slave.name: _px_min_granules_per_slave
_px_min_granules_per_slave.info: minimum number of rowid range granules to generate per slave.

secure_file_priv.name: secure_file_priv
secure_file_priv.info: limit the effect of data import and export operations
secure_file_priv.info_cn: 限制导入导出功能访问的路径
secure_file_priv.background_cn: 导入导出功能未限制文件访问可能存在漏洞

plsql_warnings.name: plsql_warnings
plsql_warnings.info: enables or disables the reporting of warning messages by the PL/SQL compiler, and specifies which warning messages to show as errors.
plsql_warnings.info_cn: 控制pl/sql编译器的报错行为，可以指定某类型或某个warning码的状态为：enable，disable，error
plsql_warnings.background_cn: pl/sql编译器的警告信息分成了几个分类，这个系统参数可以控制这些警告信息的行为

_enable_parallel_query.name: _enable_parallel_query
_enable_parallel_query.info: A QUERY statement can be parallelized only if you have explicitly enabled parallel QUERY in the session or in the SQL statement.
_enable_parallel_query.info_cn: 在session上打开parallel query配置项，查询默认情况下才可以被并行执行（parallel>=2)
_enable_parallel_query.background_cn: px上控制parallel的方式有很多，session上有对应的parallel的控制开关，这个开关用于控制session级别的默认并行度是否可以大于等于2

_force_parallel_query_dop.name: _force_parallel_query_dop
_force_parallel_query_dop.info: A QUERY statement can be parallelized only if you have explicitly enabled parallel QUERY in the session or in the SQL statement.
_force_parallel_query_dop.info_cn: 在session上打开parallel query配置项，并指定默认并行度
_force_parallel_query_dop.background_cn: px上控制parallel的方式有很多，session上有对应的parallel的控制开关，这个变量用于设置session级别的 query 默认并行度大小

_force_parallel_dml_dop.name: _force_parallel_dml_dop
_force_parallel_dml_dop.info: A QUERY statement can be parallelized only if you have explicitly enabled parallel QUERY in the session or in the SQL statement.
_force_parallel_dml_dop.info_cn: 在session上打开parallel dml配置项，并指定默认并行度。当未通过 hint 指定 dml 并行度时，会使用本变量值作为默认并行度
_force_parallel_dml_dop.background_cn: px上控制parallel的方式有很多，session上有对应的parallel的控制开关，这个变量用于设置session级别的 dml 默认并行度大小

transaction_read_only.name: transaction_read_only
transaction_read_only.info_cn: 控制是否只允许开启只读事务
transaction_read_only.background_cn: 用户可以通过这两个变量访问或者设置事务的访问模式，当transaction_read_only设置为true时，不允许执行dml语句

resource_manager_plan.name: resource_manager_plan
resource_manager_plan.info_cn: 指定租户的资源隔离计划
resource_manager_plan.background_cn: 租户内的普通线程和并行执行线程会相互抢占CPU资源，通过给租户指定资源隔离计划，可以控制资源抢占策略，隔离资源使用量

performance_schema.name: performance_schema
performance_schema.info: indicate whether the Performance Schema is enabled
performance_schema.info_cn: 向客户端声明是否支持 performance 信息查询
performance_schema.background_cn: 纯兼容性变量。不支持 performance_schema 系统变量，导致 8.0 JDBC 驱动在连接认证后初始化系统变量阶段执行 select @performance_schema 抛出异常

nls_currency.name: nls_currency
nls_currency.info: specifies the string to use as the local currency symbol for the L number format element. The default value of this parameter is determined by NLS_TERRITORY.
nls_currency.info_cn: L数字格式元素的本地货币符号
nls_currency.background_cn: 兼容 oracle number format model L 数字格式元素

nls_iso_currency.name: nls_iso_currency
nls_iso_currency.info: specifies the string to use as the international currency symbol for the C number format element. The default value of this parameter is determined by NLS_TERRITORY
nls_iso_currency.info_cn: C数字格式元素的国际货币符号
nls_iso_currency.background_cn: 兼容 oracle number format model C 数字格式元素

nls_dual_currency.name: nls_dual_currency
nls_dual_currency.info: specifies the dual currency symbol for the territory. The default is the dual currency symbol defined in the territory of your current language environment.
nls_dual_currency.info_cn: U数字格式元素的双货币符号
nls_dual_currency.background_cn: 兼容 oracle number format model U 数字格式元素

plsql_ccflags.name: plsql_ccflags
plsql_ccflags.info: Lets you control conditional compilation of each PL/SQL unit independently.

_ob_proxy_session_temporary_table_used.name: _ob_proxy_session_temporary_table_used
_ob_proxy_session_temporary_table_used.info: this value is true if we have executed set transaction stmt, until a transaction commit(explicit or implicit) successfully
_ob_proxy_session_temporary_table_used.info_cn: 标记当前Session是否使用过Session级别临时表，用于告知proxy并修改路由决策
_ob_proxy_session_temporary_table_used.background_cn: 为了解决Session临时表断链接时可能导致的问题，当Session临时表第一次使用后，后续请求Proxy只会路由到同一个Session

_enable_parallel_ddl.name: _enable_parallel_ddl
_enable_parallel_ddl.info: A DDL statement can be parallelized only if you have explicitly enabled parallel DDL in the session or in the SQL statement.
_enable_parallel_ddl.info_cn: 标记Session上并行DDL是否被打开

_force_parallel_ddl_dop.name: _force_parallel_ddl_dop
_force_parallel_ddl_dop.info: A DDL statement can be parallelized only if you have explicitly enabled parallel DDL in the session or in the SQL statement.
_force_parallel_ddl_dop.info_cn: 在session上打开parallel ddl配置项，并指定默认并行度。当未通过 hint 指定 ddl 并行度时，会使用本变量值作为默认并行度
_force_parallel_ddl_dop.background_cn: ddl上控制parallel的方式有很多，session上有对应的parallel的控制开关，这个变量用于设置session级别的 ddl 默认并行度大小

cursor_sharing.name: cursor_sharing
cursor_sharing.info: whether needs to do parameterization? EXACT - query will not do parameterization; FORCE - query will do parameterization.
cursor_sharing.info_cn: 在session上打开控制是否参数化的配置项。当处于exact模式时,不进行参数化;处于Force模式时,进行参数化。默认进行参数化。

_optimizer_null_aware_antijoin.name: _optimizer_null_aware_antijoin
_optimizer_null_aware_antijoin.info: specifies whether null aware anti join plan allow generated
_optimizer_null_aware_antijoin.info_cn: 控制优化器能否生成null aware anti join 的计划

_px_partial_rollup_pushdown.name: _px_partial_rollup_pushdown
_px_partial_rollup_pushdown.info: enable partial rollup push down optimization.

_px_dist_agg_partial_rollup_pushdown.name: _px_dist_agg_partial_rollup_pushdown
_px_dist_agg_partial_rollup_pushdown.info: enable distinct aggregate function to partial rollup push down optimization.

_create_audit_purge_job.name: _create_audit_purge_job
_create_audit_purge_job.info: control audit log trail job in mysql mode
_create_audit_purge_job.info_cn: 创建mysql模式的审计日志定期清理任务

_drop_audit_purge_job.name: _drop_audit_purge_job
_drop_audit_purge_job.info: drop audit log trail job in mysql mode
_drop_audit_purge_job.info_cn: 删除mysql模式的审计日志定期清理任务

_set_purge_job_interval.name: _set_purge_job_interval
_set_purge_job_interval.info: set purge job interval in mysql mode, range in 1-999 days

_set_purge_job_status.name: _set_purge_job_status
_set_purge_job_status.info: set purge job status in mysql mode, range: true/false
_set_purge_job_status.info_cn: 更新purge job的状态，控制job是否生效

_set_last_archive_timestamp.name: _set_last_archive_timestamp
_set_last_archive_timestamp.info: set last archive timestamp in mysql mode, must utc time in usec from 1970
_set_last_archive_timestamp.info_cn: 设置删除的时间点信息，需要使用从1970开始的utc时间，微妙为单位

_clear_last_archive_timestamp.name: _clear_last_archive_timestamp
_clear_last_archive_timestamp.info: clear last archive timestamp in mysql mode
_clear_last_archive_timestamp.info_cn: 清除删除的时间点信息

_aggregation_optimization_settings.name: _aggregation_optimization_settings
_aggregation_optimization_settings.info: Manually control some behaviors of aggregation
_aggregation_optimization_settings.background_cn: 用于调优group by 和distinct的执行行为

_px_shared_hash_join.name: _px_shared_hash_join
_px_shared_hash_join.info: enable shared hash table hash join optimization.

innodb_strict_mode.name: innodb_strict_mode
innodb_strict_mode.info: in certain case, warnings would be transformed to errors
innodb_strict_mode.info_cn: 特定场合下，警告会当成错误返回

log_row_value_options.name: log_row_value_options
log_row_value_options.info: control whether lob use partial update

ob_max_read_stale_time.name: ob_max_read_stale_time
ob_max_read_stale_time.info: max stale time(us) for weak read query

_optimizer_gather_stats_on_load.name: _optimizer_gather_stats_on_load
_optimizer_gather_stats_on_load.info: control wether we need to gather optimizer stats on insert into select/create table as select
_optimizer_gather_stats_on_load.info_cn: 控制在insert into select下是否默认收集统计信息

_set_reverse_dblink_infos.name: _set_reverse_dblink_infos
_set_reverse_dblink_infos.info: used in the dblink write transaction, the TM side informs the RM side of the necessary information about establishing a reverse dblink by setting system variables
_set_reverse_dblink_infos.info_cn: 用于dblink写事务中, TM端通过设置系统变量的方式告知RM端关于建立反向dblink的必要信息

_force_order_preserve_set.name: _force_order_preserve_set
_force_order_preserve_set.info: can control the behavior of set query, when true, set query will generate a serial plan, which ensure the output order of result set is ordered
_force_order_preserve_set.flags: GLOBAL | SESSION | INFLUENCE_PLAN | NEED_SERIALIZE | ORACLE_ONLY | INVISIBLE
_force_order_preserve_set.info_cn: 用于控制set query的改写行为和计划生成逻辑，保证分支串行执行和结果集顺序

_show_ddl_in_compat_mode.name: _show_ddl_in_compat_mode
_show_ddl_in_compat_mode.info: When enabled, show create table will show the strict compatible results with the compatibility mode.
_show_ddl_in_compat_mode.info_cn: 启用后, show create table 将展示与兼容模式严格兼容的结果

parallel_degree_policy.name: parallel_degree_policy
parallel_degree_policy.info: specifies whether automatic degree of parallelism will be enabled

parallel_degree_limit.name: parallel_degree_limit
parallel_degree_limit.info: limits the degree of parallelism used by the optimizer when automatic degree of parallelism is enabled
parallel_degree_limit.info_cn: 使用 Auto DOP 策略时, 限制优化器选择并行度上限值

parallel_min_scan_time_threshold.name: parallel_min_scan_time_threshold
parallel_min_scan_time_threshold.info: specifies the minimum execution time a table scan should have before it's considered for automatic degree of parallelism, variable unit is milliseconds
parallel_min_scan_time_threshold.info_cn: 使用 Auto DOP 策略时, 增大基表扫描并行度参考执行时间, 单位 ms

runtime_filter_type.name: runtime_filter_type
runtime_filter_type.info: set runtime filter type, including the bloom_filter/range/in filter

runtime_filter_wait_time_ms.name: runtime_filter_wait_time_ms
runtime_filter_wait_time_ms.info: set default wait time ms for runtime filter, default is 10ms

runtime_filter_max_in_num.name: runtime_filter_max_in_num
runtime_filter_max_in_num.info: set max in number for runtime in filter, default is 1024

runtime_bloom_filter_max_size.name: runtime_bloom_filter_max_size
runtime_bloom_filter_max_size.info: set max size for single runtime bloom filter, default is 2GB

optimizer_features_enable.name: optimizer_features_enable
optimizer_features_enable.info: enabling a series of optimizer features based on an OceanBase release number

_ob_proxy_weakread_feedback.name: _ob_proxy_weakread_feedback
_ob_proxy_weakread_feedback.info: In the weak read state, the replica status of the current machine is fed back to the proxy.

ncharacter_set_connection.name: ncharacter_set_connection
ncharacter_set_connection.info: The national character set which should be translated to response nstring data

automatic_sp_privileges.name: automatic_sp_privileges
automatic_sp_privileges.info: the server automatically grants the EXECUTE and ALTER ROUTINE privileges to the creator of a stored routine

privilege_features_enable.name: privilege_features_enable
privilege_features_enable.info: enabling a series of privilege features based on an OceanBase release number

_priv_control.name: _priv_control
_priv_control.info: whether turn on mysql privilege check

_enable_mysql_pl_priv_check.name: _enable_mysql_pl_priv_check
_enable_mysql_pl_priv_check.info: specifies whether check the mysql routine priv

ob_enable_pl_cache.name: ob_enable_pl_cache
ob_enable_pl_cache.info: whether use pl cache in session

lc_time_names.name: lc_time_names
lc_time_names.info: The locale indicated by the lc_time_names system variable controls the language used to display day and month names and abbreviations

activate_all_roles_on_login.name: activate_all_roles_on_login
activate_all_roles_on_login.info: whether to enable automatic activation of all granted roles when users log in to the server

_enable_rich_vector_format.name: _enable_rich_vector_format
_enable_rich_vector_format.info: whether use rich vector format in vectorized execution engine
_enable_rich_vector_format.info_cn: 在向量化引擎中, 开启/关闭使用多种列格式描述功能

innodb_stats_persistent.name: innodb_stats_persistent
innodb_stats_persistent.info: Specifies whether InnoDB index statistics are persisted to disk.
innodb_stats_persistent.info_cn: 指定InnoDB索引统计信息是否持久化到磁盘

debug.name: debug
debug.info: This variable indicates the current debugging settings

innodb_change_buffering_debug.name: innodb_change_buffering_debug
innodb_change_buffering_debug.info: Sets a debug flag for InnoDB change buffering.

innodb_compress_debug.name: innodb_compress_debug
innodb_compress_debug.info: Compresses all tables using a specified compression algorithm without having to define a COMPRESSION attribute for each table.

innodb_disable_resize_buffer_pool_debug.name: innodb_disable_resize_buffer_pool_debug
innodb_disable_resize_buffer_pool_debug.info: Disables resizing of the InnoDB buffer pool

innodb_fil_make_page_dirty_debug.name: innodb_fil_make_page_dirty_debug
innodb_fil_make_page_dirty_debug.info: set to 1 (the default by MySQL), foreign key constraints are checked. If set to 0, foreign key constraints are ignored

innodb_limit_optimistic_insert_debug.name: innodb_limit_optimistic_insert_debug
innodb_limit_optimistic_insert_debug.info: Limits the number of records per B-tree page

innodb_merge_threshold_set_all_debug.name: innodb_merge_threshold_set_all_debug
innodb_merge_threshold_set_all_debug.info: Defines a page-full percentage value for index pages that overrides the current MERGE_THRESHOLD setting for all indexes that are currently in the dictionary cache

innodb_saved_page_number_debug.name: innodb_saved_page_number_debug
innodb_saved_page_number_debug.info: Saves a page number. Setting the innodb_fil_make_page_dirty_debug option dirties the page defined by innodb_saved_page_number_debug

innodb_trx_purge_view_update_only_debug.name: innodb_trx_purge_view_update_only_debug
innodb_trx_purge_view_update_only_debug.info: Pauses purging of delete-marked records while allowing the purge view to be updated

innodb_trx_rseg_n_slots_debug.name: innodb_trx_rseg_n_slots_debug
innodb_trx_rseg_n_slots_debug.info: Sets a debug flag that limits TRX_RSEG_N_SLOTS to a given value for the trx_rsegf_undo_find_free function that looks for free slots for undo log segments

stored_program_cache.name: stored_program_cache
stored_program_cache.info: Sets a soft upper limit for the number of cached stored routines per connection

ob_compatibility_control.name: ob_compatibility_control
ob_compatibility_control.info: specifies the compatible mode when the behaviors of MySQL 5.7 and MySQL 8.0 are different

ob_compatibility_version.name: ob_compatibility_version
ob_compatibility_version.info: specifies the compatible verision when the behaviors of different release version are different

ob_security_version.name: ob_security_version
ob_security_version.info: specifies the security verision when the behaviors of different release version are different

cardinality_estimation_model.name: cardinality_estimation_model
cardinality_estimation_model.info: Specifies the correlation model when the optimizer estimates cardinality

query_rewrite_enabled.name: query_rewrite_enabled
query_rewrite_enabled.info: Whether to enable the materialized view rewriting

query_rewrite_integrity.name: query_rewrite_integrity
query_rewrite_integrity.info: Control the data integrity of materialized view rewriting

flush.name: flush
flush.info: If ON, the server flushes (synchronizes) all changes to disk after each SQL statement

flush_time.name: flush_time
flush_time.info: if this is set to a nonzero value, all tables are closed every flush_time seconds to free up resources and synchronize unflushed data to disk

innodb_adaptive_flushing.name: innodb_adaptive_flushing
innodb_adaptive_flushing.info: specifies whether to dynamically adjust the rate of flushing dirty pages in the InnoDB buffer pool based on the workload

innodb_adaptive_flushing_lwm.name: innodb_adaptive_flushing_lwm
innodb_adaptive_flushing_lwm.info: Defines the low water mark representing percentage of redo log capacity at which adaptive flushing is enabled

innodb_adaptive_hash_index.name: innodb_adaptive_hash_index
innodb_adaptive_hash_index.info: Whether the InnoDB adaptive hash index is enabled or disabled. It may be desirable, depending on your workload, to dynamically enable or disable adaptive hash indexing to improve query performance

innodb_adaptive_hash_index_parts.name: innodb_adaptive_hash_index_parts
innodb_adaptive_hash_index_parts.info: Partitions the adaptive hash index search system. Each index is bound to a specific partition, with each partition protected by a separate latch.

innodb_adaptive_max_sleep_delay.name: innodb_adaptive_max_sleep_delay
innodb_adaptive_max_sleep_delay.info: Permits InnoDB to automatically adjust the value of innodb_thread_sleep_delay up or down according to the current workload

innodb_autoextend_increment.name: innodb_autoextend_increment
innodb_autoextend_increment.info: The increment size (in megabytes) for extending the size of an auto-extending InnoDB system tablespace file when it becomes full

innodb_background_drop_list_empty.name: innodb_background_drop_list_empty
innodb_background_drop_list_empty.info: Enabling the innodb_background_drop_list_empty debug option helps avoid test case failures by delaying table creation until the background drop list is empty

innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown.name: innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown
innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown.info: Specifies whether to record the pages cached in the InnoDB buffer pool when the MySQL server is shut down, to shorten the warmup process at the next restart

innodb_buffer_pool_dump_now.name: innodb_buffer_pool_dump_now
innodb_buffer_pool_dump_now.info: Immediately makes a record of pages cached in the InnoDB buffer pool

innodb_buffer_pool_dump_pct.name: innodb_buffer_pool_dump_pct
innodb_buffer_pool_dump_pct.info: Specifies the percentage of the most recently used pages for each buffer pool to read out and dump

innodb_buffer_pool_filename.name: innodb_buffer_pool_filename
innodb_buffer_pool_filename.info: Specifies the name of the file that holds the list of tablespace IDs and page IDs produced by innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown or innodb_buffer_pool_dump_now

innodb_buffer_pool_load_abort.name: innodb_buffer_pool_load_abort
innodb_buffer_pool_load_abort.info: Interrupts the process of restoring InnoDB buffer pool contents triggered by innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup or innodb_buffer_pool_load_now

innodb_buffer_pool_load_now.name: innodb_buffer_pool_load_now
innodb_buffer_pool_load_now.info: Immediately warms up the InnoDB buffer pool by loading data pages without waiting for a server restart

innodb_buffer_pool_size.name: innodb_buffer_pool_size
innodb_buffer_pool_size.info: The size in bytes of the buffer pool, the memory area where InnoDB caches table and index data

innodb_change_buffer_max_size.name: innodb_change_buffer_max_size
innodb_change_buffer_max_size.info: Maximum size for the InnoDB change buffer, as a percentage of the total size of the buffer pool.

innodb_change_buffering.name: innodb_change_buffering
innodb_change_buffering.info: Whether InnoDB performs change buffering, an optimization that delays write operations to secondary indexes so that the I/O operations can be performed sequentially

innodb_checksum_algorithm.name: innodb_checksum_algorithm
innodb_checksum_algorithm.info: Specifies how to generate and verify the checksum stored in the disk blocks of InnoDB tablespaces

innodb_cmp_per_index_enabled.name: innodb_cmp_per_index_enabled
innodb_cmp_per_index_enabled.info: Enables per-index compression-related statistics in the Information Schema INNODB_CMP_PER_INDEX table

innodb_commit_concurrency.name: innodb_commit_concurrency
innodb_commit_concurrency.info: The number of threads that can commit at the same time. A value of 0 (the default) permits any number of transactions to commit simultaneously

innodb_compression_failure_threshold_pct.name: innodb_compression_failure_threshold_pct
innodb_compression_failure_threshold_pct.info: Defines the compression failure rate threshold for a table, as a percentage, at which point MySQL begins adding padding within compressed pages to avoid expensive compression failures

innodb_compression_level.name: innodb_compression_level
innodb_compression_level.info: Specifies the level of zlib compression to use for InnoDB compressed tables and indexes

innodb_compression_pad_pct_max.name: innodb_compression_pad_pct_max
innodb_compression_pad_pct_max.info: Specifies the maximum percentage that can be reserved as free space within each compressed page, allowing room to reorganize the data and modification log within the page when a compressed table or index is updated and the data might be recompressed

innodb_concurrency_tickets.name: innodb_concurrency_tickets
innodb_concurrency_tickets.info: Determines the number of threads that can enter InnoDB concurrently

innodb_default_row_format.name: innodb_default_row_format
innodb_default_row_format.info: The innodb_default_row_format option defines the default row format for InnoDB tables and user-created temporary tables

innodb_disable_sort_file_cache.name: innodb_disable_sort_file_cache
innodb_disable_sort_file_cache.info: Disables the operating system file system cache for merge-sort temporary files. The effect is to open such files with the equivalent of O_DIRECT

innodb_file_format.name: innodb_file_format
innodb_file_format.info: Enables an InnoDB file format for file-per-table tablespaces

innodb_file_format_max.name: innodb_file_format_max
innodb_file_format_max.info: At server startup, InnoDB sets the value of this variable to the file format tag in the system tablespace (for example, Antelope or Barracuda)

innodb_file_per_table.name: innodb_file_per_table
innodb_file_per_table.info: When innodb_file_per_table is enabled, tables are created in file-per-table tablespaces by default

innodb_fill_factor.name: innodb_fill_factor
innodb_fill_factor.info: InnoDB performs a bulk load when creating or rebuilding indexes

innodb_flush_neighbors.name: innodb_flush_neighbors
innodb_flush_neighbors.info: Specifies whether flushing a page from the InnoDB buffer pool also flushes other dirty pages in the same extent

innodb_flush_sync.name: innodb_flush_sync
innodb_flush_sync.info: The innodb_flush_sync variable, which is enabled by default, causes the innodb_io_capacity setting to be ignored during bursts of I/O activity that occur at checkpoints

innodb_flushing_avg_loops.name: innodb_flushing_avg_loops
innodb_flushing_avg_loops.info: Number of iterations for which InnoDB keeps the previously calculated snapshot of the flushing state, controlling how quickly adaptive flushing responds to changing workloads

innodb_lru_scan_depth.name: innodb_lru_scan_depth
innodb_lru_scan_depth.info: A parameter that influences the algorithms and heuristics for the flush operation for the InnoDB buffer pool. Primarily of interest to performance experts tuning I/O-intensive workloads

innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct.name: innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct
innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct.info: InnoDB tries to flush data from the buffer pool so that the percentage of dirty pages does not exceed this value

innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct_lwm.name: innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct_lwm
innodb_max_dirty_pages_pct_lwm.info: Defines a low water mark representing the percentage of dirty pages at which preflushing is enabled to control the dirty page ratio

innodb_max_purge_lag.name: innodb_max_purge_lag
innodb_max_purge_lag.info: Defines the desired maximum purge lag. If this value is exceeded, a delay is imposed on INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE operations to allow time for purge to catch up

innodb_max_purge_lag_delay.name: innodb_max_purge_lag_delay
innodb_max_purge_lag_delay.info: Specifies the maximum delay in microseconds for the delay imposed when the innodb_max_purge_lag threshold is exceeded

have_symlink.name: have_symlink
have_symlink.info: This is required on Unix for support of the DATA DIRECTORY and INDEX DIRECTORY table options

ignore_builtin_innodb.name: ignore_builtin_innodb
ignore_builtin_innodb.info: In earlier versions of MySQL, enabling this variable caused the server to behave as if the built-in InnoDB were not present, which enabled the InnoDB Plugin to be used instead

innodb_buffer_pool_chunk_size.name: innodb_buffer_pool_chunk_size
innodb_buffer_pool_chunk_size.info: defines the chunk size for InnoDB buffer pool resizing operations

innodb_buffer_pool_instances.name: innodb_buffer_pool_instances
innodb_buffer_pool_instances.info: defines the chunk size for InnoDB buffer pool resizing operations

innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup.name: innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup
innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup.info: Specifies that, on MySQL server startup, the InnoDB buffer pool is automatically warmed up by loading the same pages it held at an earlier time

innodb_checksums.name: innodb_checksums
innodb_checksums.info: InnoDB can use checksum validation on all tablespace pages read from disk to ensure extra fault tolerance against hardware faults or corrupted data files

innodb_doublewrite.name: innodb_doublewrite
innodb_doublewrite.info: When enabled (the default), InnoDB stores all data twice, first to the doublewrite buffer, then to the actual data files

innodb_file_format_check.name: innodb_file_format_check
innodb_file_format_check.info: This variable can be set to 1 or 0 at server startup to enable or disable whether InnoDB checks the file format tag in the system tablespace (for example, Antelope or Barracuda)

innodb_flush_method.name: innodb_flush_method
innodb_flush_method.info: Defines the method used to flush data to InnoDB data files and log files, which can affect I/O throughput

innodb_force_load_corrupted.name: innodb_force_load_corrupted
innodb_force_load_corrupted.info: Permits InnoDB to load tables at startup that are marked as corrupted

innodb_page_size.name: innodb_page_size
innodb_page_size.info: Specifies the page size for InnoDB tablespaces. Values can be specified in bytes or kilobytes

myisam_mmap_size.name: myisam_mmap_size
myisam_mmap_size.info: The maximum amount of memory to use for memory mapping compressed MyISAM files

table_open_cache_instances.name: table_open_cache_instances
table_open_cache_instances.info: The maximum amount of memory to use for memory mapping compressed MyISAM files

gtid_executed.name: gtid_executed
gtid_executed.info: When used with global scope, this variable contains a representation of the set of all transactions executed on the server and GTIDs that have been set by a SET gtid_purged statement, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

gtid_owned.name: gtid_owned
gtid_owned.info: When used with global scope, gtid_owned holds a list of all the GTIDs that are currently in use on the server, with the IDs of the threads that own them. When used with session scope, gtid_owned holds a single GTID that is currently in use by and owned by this session, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

innodb_rollback_on_timeout.name: innodb_rollback_on_timeout
innodb_rollback_on_timeout.info: InnoDB rolls back only the last statement on a transaction timeout by default. If --innodb-rollback-on-timeout is specified, a transaction timeout causes InnoDB to abort and roll back the entire transaction, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

completion_type.name: completion_type
completion_type.info: completion_type affects transactions that begin with START TRANSACTION or BEGIN and end with COMMIT or ROLLBACK. It does not apply for XA COMMIT, XA ROLLBACK, or when autocommit=1, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

enforce_gtid_consistency.name: enforce_gtid_consistency
enforce_gtid_consistency.info: Depending on the value of this variable, the server enforces GTID consistency by allowing execution of only statements that can be safely logged using a GTID. You must set this variable to ON before enabling GTID based replication, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

gtid_executed_compression_period.name: gtid_executed_compression_period
gtid_executed_compression_period.info: Compress the mysql.gtid_executed table each time this many transactions have been processed, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

gtid_mode.name: gtid_mode
gtid_mode.info: Controls whether GTID based logging is enabled and what type of transactions the logs can contain, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

gtid_next.name: gtid_next
gtid_next.info: This variable is used to specify whether and how the next GTID is obtained, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

gtid_purged.name: gtid_purged
gtid_purged.info: The global value of the gtid_purged system variable is a GTID set consisting of the GTIDs of all the transactions that have been committed on the server, but do not exist in any binary log file on the server. gtid_purged is a subset of gtid_executed, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

innodb_api_bk_commit_interval.name: innodb_api_bk_commit_interval
innodb_api_bk_commit_interval.info: How often to auto-commit idle connections that use the InnoDB memcached interface, in seconds, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

innodb_api_trx_level.name: innodb_api_trx_level
innodb_api_trx_level.info: Controls the transaction isolation level on queries processed by the memcached interface, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

innodb_support_xa.name: innodb_support_xa
innodb_support_xa.info: Enables InnoDB support for two-phase commit in XA transactions, causing an extra disk flush for transaction preparation, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

session_track_gtids.name: session_track_gtids
session_track_gtids.info: Controls whether the server returns GTIDs to the client, enabling the client to use them to track the server state, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

session_track_transaction_info.name: session_track_transaction_info
session_track_transaction_info.info: Controls whether the server tracks the state and characteristics of transactions within the current session and notifies the client to make this information available, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

transaction_alloc_block_size.name: transaction_alloc_block_size
transaction_alloc_block_size.info: The amount in bytes by which to increase a per-transaction memory pool which needs memory, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

transaction_allow_batching.name: transaction_allow_batching
transaction_allow_batching.info: When set to 1 or ON, this variable enables batching of statements within the same transaction. To use this variable, autocommit must first be disabled by setting it to 0 or OFF; otherwise, setting transaction_allow_batching has no effect, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

transaction_prealloc_size.name: transaction_prealloc_size
transaction_prealloc_size.info: There is a per-transaction memory pool from which various transaction-related allocations take memory. The initial size of the pool in bytes is transaction_prealloc_size, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

transaction_write_set_extraction.name: transaction_write_set_extraction
transaction_write_set_extraction.info: Defines the algorithm used to generate a hash identifying the writes associated with a transaction, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

information_schema_stats_expiry.name: information_schema_stats_expiry
information_schema_stats_expiry.info: The number of seconds after which the server will fetch data from storage engine and replace the data in cache.

_oracle_sql_select_limit.name: _oracle_sql_select_limit
_oracle_sql_select_limit.info: used by JDBC setMaxRows() interface to specify limitation of row number in ResultSet

group_replication_allow_local_disjoint_g.name: group_replication_allow_local_disjoint_gtids_join
group_replication_allow_local_disjoint_g.info: Allows the server to join the group even if it has local transactions that are not present in the group

group_replication_allow_local_lower_vers.name: group_replication_allow_local_lower_version_join
group_replication_allow_local_lower_vers.info: Allows the current server to join the group even if it has a lower major version than the group

group_replication_auto_increment_increme.name: group_replication_auto_increment_increment
group_replication_auto_increment_increme.info: Determines the interval between successive column values for transactions that execute on this server instance

group_replication_bootstrap_group.name: group_replication_bootstrap_group
group_replication_bootstrap_group.info: Configure this server to bootstrap the group

group_replication_components_stop_timeou.name: group_replication_components_stop_timeout
group_replication_components_stop_timeou.info: Timeout, in seconds, that Group Replication waits for each of the components when shutting down

group_replication_compression_threshold.name: group_replication_compression_threshold
group_replication_compression_threshold.info: The threshold value in bytes above which compression is applied to messages sent between group members

group_replication_enforce_update_everywh.name: group_replication_enforce_update_everywhere_checks
group_replication_enforce_update_everywh.info: Enable or disable strict consistency checks for multi-primary update everywhere

group_replication_exit_state_action.name: group_replication_exit_state_action
group_replication_exit_state_action.info: Configures how Group Replication behaves when a server instance leaves the group unintentionally, for example after encountering an applier error, or in the case of a loss of majority, or when another member of the group expels it due to a suspicion timing out

group_replication_flow_control_applier_t.name: group_replication_flow_control_applier_threshold
group_replication_flow_control_applier_t.info: Specifies the number of waiting transactions in the applier queue that trigger flow control. This variable can be changed without resetting Group Replication

group_replication_flow_control_certifier.name: group_replication_flow_control_certifier_threshold
group_replication_flow_control_certifier.info: Specifies the number of waiting transactions in the certifier queue that trigger flow control. This variable can be changed without resetting Group Replication

group_replication_flow_control_mode.name: group_replication_flow_control_mode
group_replication_flow_control_mode.info: Specifies the mode used for flow control. This variable can be changed without resetting Group Replication

group_replication_force_members.name: group_replication_force_members
group_replication_force_members.info: A list of peer addresses as a comma separated list such as host1:port1,host2:port2

group_replication_group_name.name: group_replication_group_name
group_replication_group_name.info: The name of the group which this server instance belongs to. Must be a valid UUID. This UUID is used internally when setting GTIDs for Group Replication events in the binary log

group_replication_gtid_assignment_block_.name: group_replication_gtid_assignment_block_size
group_replication_gtid_assignment_block_.info: The number of consecutive GTIDs that are reserved for each member. Each member consumes its blocks and reserves more when needed

group_replication_ip_whitelist.name: group_replication_ip_whitelist
group_replication_ip_whitelist.info: Specifies the allowlist of hosts that are permitted to connect to the group

group_replication_local_address.name: group_replication_local_address
group_replication_local_address.info: The network address which the member provides for connections from other members, specified as a host:port formatted string

group_replication_member_weight.name: group_replication_member_weight
group_replication_member_weight.info: A percentage weight that can be assigned to members to influence the chance of the member being elected as primary in the event of failover, for example when the existing primary leaves a single-primary group

group_replication_poll_spin_loops.name: group_replication_poll_spin_loops
group_replication_poll_spin_loops.info: The number of times the group communication thread waits for the communication engine mutex to be released before the thread waits for more incoming network messages

group_replication_recovery_complete_at.name: group_replication_recovery_complete_at
group_replication_recovery_complete_at.info: Recovery policies when handling cached transactions after state transfer

group_replication_recovery_reconnect_int.name: group_replication_recovery_reconnect_interval
group_replication_recovery_reconnect_int.info: The sleep time, in seconds, between reconnection attempts when no donor was found in the group

group_replication_recovery_retry_count.name: group_replication_recovery_retry_count
group_replication_recovery_retry_count.info: The number of times that the member that is joining tries to connect to the available donors before giving up

group_replication_recovery_ssl_ca.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_ca
group_replication_recovery_ssl_ca.info: The path to a file that contains a list of trusted SSL certificate authorities

group_replication_recovery_ssl_capath.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_capath
group_replication_recovery_ssl_capath.info: The path to a directory that contains trusted SSL certificate authority certificates

group_replication_recovery_ssl_cert.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_cert
group_replication_recovery_ssl_cert.info: The name of the SSL certificate file to use for establishing a secure connection

group_replication_recovery_ssl_cipher.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_cipher
group_replication_recovery_ssl_cipher.info: The list of permissible ciphers for SSL encryption

group_replication_recovery_ssl_crl.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_crl
group_replication_recovery_ssl_crl.info: The path to a directory that contains files containing certificate revocation lists

group_replication_recovery_ssl_crlpath.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_crlpath
group_replication_recovery_ssl_crlpath.info: The path to a directory that contains files containing certificate revocation lists

group_replication_recovery_ssl_key.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_key
group_replication_recovery_ssl_key.info: The name of the SSL key file to use for establishing a secure connection

group_replication_recovery_ssl_verify_se.name: group_replication_recovery_ssl_verify_server_cert
group_replication_recovery_ssl_verify_se.info: Make the recovery process check the server's Common Name value in the donor sent certificate

group_replication_recovery_use_ssl.name: group_replication_recovery_use_ssl
group_replication_recovery_use_ssl.info: Whether Group Replication recovery connection should use SSL or not

group_replication_single_primary_mode.name: group_replication_single_primary_mode
group_replication_single_primary_mode.info: Instructs the group to pick a single server automatically to be the one that handles read/write workload. This server is the primary and all others are secondaries

group_replication_ssl_mode.name: group_replication_ssl_mode
group_replication_ssl_mode.info: Specifies the security state of the connection between Group Replication members

group_replication_start_on_boot.name: group_replication_start_on_boot
group_replication_start_on_boot.info: Whether the server should start Group Replication or not during server start

group_replication_transaction_size_limit.name: group_replication_transaction_size_limit
group_replication_transaction_size_limit.info: Configures the maximum transaction size in bytes which the replication group accepts

group_replication_unreachable_majority_t.name: group_replication_unreachable_majority_timeout
group_replication_unreachable_majority_t.info: Configures how long members that suffer a network partition and cannot connect to the majority wait before leaving the group

innodb_replication_delay.name: innodb_replication_delay
innodb_replication_delay.info: The replication thread delay in milliseconds on a replica server if innodb_thread_concurrency is reached

master_info_repository.name: master_info_repository
master_info_repository.info: The setting of this variable determines whether the replica records metadata about the source, consisting of status and connection information, to an InnoDB table in the mysql system database, or as a file in the data directory

master_verify_checksum.name: master_verify_checksum
master_verify_checksum.info: Enabling this variable causes the source to verify events read from the binary log by examining checksums, and to stop with an error in the event of a mismatch

pseudo_slave_mode.name: pseudo_slave_mode
pseudo_slave_mode.info: Assists with the correct handling of transactions that originated on older or newer servers than the server currently processing them

pseudo_thread_id.name: pseudo_thread_id
pseudo_thread_id.info: This variable is for internal server use

replication_optimize_for_static_plugin_c.name: replication_optimize_for_static_plugin_config
replication_optimize_for_static_plugin_c.info: Use shared locks, and avoid unnecessary lock acquisitions, to improve performance for semisynchronous replication

replication_sender_observe_commit_only.name: replication_sender_observe_commit_only
replication_sender_observe_commit_only.info: Limit callbacks to improve performance for semisynchronous replication

rpl_semi_sync_master_enabled.name: rpl_semi_sync_master_enabled
rpl_semi_sync_master_enabled.info: Controls whether semisynchronous replication is enabled on the source

rpl_semi_sync_master_timeout.name: rpl_semi_sync_master_timeout
rpl_semi_sync_master_timeout.info: A value in milliseconds that controls how long the source waits on a commit for acknowledgment from a replica before timing out and reverting to asynchronous replication

rpl_semi_sync_master_trace_level.name: rpl_semi_sync_master_trace_level
rpl_semi_sync_master_trace_level.info: The semisynchronous replication debug trace level on the source

rpl_semi_sync_master_wait_for_slave_coun.name: rpl_semi_sync_master_wait_for_slave_count
rpl_semi_sync_master_wait_for_slave_coun.info: The number of replica acknowledgments the source must receive per transaction before proceeding

rpl_semi_sync_master_wait_no_slave.name: rpl_semi_sync_master_wait_no_slave
rpl_semi_sync_master_wait_no_slave.info: Controls whether the source waits for the timeout period configured by rpl_semi_sync_master_timeout to expire, even if the replica count drops to less than the number of replicas configured by rpl_semi_sync_master_wait_for_slave_count during the timeout period

rpl_semi_sync_master_wait_point.name: rpl_semi_sync_master_wait_point
rpl_semi_sync_master_wait_point.info: This variable controls the point at which a semisynchronous source waits for replica acknowledgment of transaction receipt before returning a status to the client that committed the transaction

rpl_semi_sync_slave_enabled.name: rpl_semi_sync_slave_enabled
rpl_semi_sync_slave_enabled.info: Controls whether semisynchronous replication is enabled on the replica

rpl_semi_sync_slave_trace_level.name: rpl_semi_sync_slave_trace_level
rpl_semi_sync_slave_trace_level.info: The semisynchronous replication debug trace level on the replica

rpl_stop_slave_timeout.name: rpl_stop_slave_timeout
rpl_stop_slave_timeout.info: You can control the length of time (in seconds) that STOP SLAVE waits before timing out by setting this variab

slave_allow_batching.name: slave_allow_batching
slave_allow_batching.info: Whether or not batched updates are enabled on NDB Cluster replicas

slave_checkpoint_group.name: slave_checkpoint_group
slave_checkpoint_group.info: Sets the maximum number of transactions that can be processed by a multithreaded replica before a checkpoint operation is called to update its status as shown by SHOW SLAVE STATUS

slave_checkpoint_period.name: slave_checkpoint_period
slave_checkpoint_period.info: Sets the maximum time (in milliseconds) that is allowed to pass before a checkpoint operation is called to update the status of a multithreaded replica as shown by SHOW SLAVE STATUS

slave_compressed_protocol.name: slave_compressed_protocol
slave_compressed_protocol.info: Whether to use compression of the source/replica protocol if both source and replica support it

slave_exec_mode.name: slave_exec_mode
slave_exec_mode.info: Controls how a replication thread resolves conflicts and errors during replication

slave_max_allowed_packet.name: slave_max_allowed_packet
slave_max_allowed_packet.info: This variable sets the maximum packet size for the replication SQL and I/O threads, so that large updates using row-based replication do not cause replication to fail because an update exceeded max_allowed_packet

slave_net_timeout.name: slave_net_timeout
slave_net_timeout.info: The number of seconds to wait for more data or a heartbeat signal from the source before the replica considers the connection broken, aborts the read, and tries to reconnect

slave_parallel_type.name: slave_parallel_type
slave_parallel_type.info: When using a multithreaded replica (slave_parallel_workers is greater than 0), this variable specifies the policy used to decide which transactions are allowed to execute in parallel on the replica

slave_parallel_workers.name: slave_parallel_workers
slave_parallel_workers.info: Sets the number of applier threads for executing replication transactions in parallel

slave_pending_jobs_size_max.name: slave_pending_jobs_size_max
slave_pending_jobs_size_max.info: For multithreaded replicas, this variable sets the maximum amount of memory (in bytes) available to worker queues holding events not yet applied

slave_preserve_commit_order.name: slave_preserve_commit_order
slave_preserve_commit_order.info: For multithreaded replicas, the setting 1 for this variable ensures that transactions are externalized on the replica in the same order as they appear in the replica's relay log, and prevents gaps in the sequence of transactions that have been executed from the relay lo

slave_sql_verify_checksum.name: slave_sql_verify_checksum
slave_sql_verify_checksum.info: Cause the replication SQL thread to verify data using the checksums read from the relay log

slave_transaction_retries.name: slave_transaction_retries
slave_transaction_retries.info: Deadlock or because the transaction's execution time exceeded InnoDB's innodb_lock_wait_timeout or NDB's TransactionDeadlockDetectionTimeout or TransactionInactiveTimeout, it automatically retries slave_transaction_retries times before stopping with an error. Transactions with a non-temporary error are not retried

sql_slave_skip_counter.name: sql_slave_skip_counter
sql_slave_skip_counter.info: The number of events from the source that a replica should ski

innodb_force_recovery.name: innodb_force_recovery
innodb_force_recovery.info: The crash recovery mode, typically only changed in serious troubleshooting situations. Possible values are from 0 to 6

skip_slave_start.name: skip_slave_start
skip_slave_start.info: Tells the replica server not to start the replication threads when the server starts

slave_load_tmpdir.name: slave_load_tmpdir
slave_load_tmpdir.info: The name of the directory where the replica creates temporary files

slave_skip_errors.name: slave_skip_errors
slave_skip_errors.info: This variable causes the replication SQL thread to continue replication when a statement returns any of the errors listed in the variable value

innodb_sync_debug.name: innodb_sync_debug
innodb_sync_debug.info: Enables sync debug checking for the InnoDB storage engine

default_collation_for_utf8mb4.name: default_collation_for_utf8mb4
default_collation_for_utf8mb4.info_cn: 用于设置utf8mb4字符集默认的字符集

_enable_old_charset_aggregation.name: _enable_old_charset_aggregation
_enable_old_charset_aggregation.info: control wether to enable old charset aggregation rule
_enable_old_charset_aggregation.flags: GLOBAL | SESSION | INFLUENCE_PLAN | NEED_SERIALIZE | MYSQL_ONLY | INVISIBLE
_enable_old_charset_aggregation.info_cn: 用于控制是否使用旧版字符集推导规则

enable_sql_plan_monitor.name: enable_sql_plan_monitor
enable_sql_plan_monitor.info: To set whether the SQL for the current session is logged into the SQL plan monitor.

insert_id.name: insert_id
insert_id.info: The value to be used by the following INSERT or ALTER TABLE statement when inserting an AUTO_INCREMENT value. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

join_buffer_size.name: join_buffer_size
join_buffer_size.info: The minimum size of the buffer that is used for plain index scans, range index scans, and joins that do not use indexes and thus perform full table scans. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

max_join_size.name: max_join_size
max_join_size.info: Do not permit statements that probably need to examine more than max_join_size rows (for single-table statements) or row combinations (for multiple-table statements) or that are likely to do more than max_join_size disk seeks. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

max_length_for_sort_data.name: max_length_for_sort_data
max_length_for_sort_data.info: The cutoff on the size of index values that determines which filesort algorithm to use. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

max_prepared_stmt_count.name: max_prepared_stmt_count
max_prepared_stmt_count.info: This variable limits the total number of prepared statements in the server. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

max_sort_length.name: max_sort_length
max_sort_length.info: The number of bytes to use when sorting data values. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

min_examined_row_limit.name: min_examined_row_limit
min_examined_row_limit.info: Queries that examine fewer than this number of rows are not logged to the slow query log. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

multi_range_count.name: multi_range_count
multi_range_count.info: This variable has no effect. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

mysqlx_connect_timeout.name: mysqlx_connect_timeout
mysqlx_connect_timeout.info: The number of seconds X Plugin waits for the first packet to be received from newly connected clients. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

mysqlx_idle_worker_thread_timeout.name: mysqlx_idle_worker_thread_timeout
mysqlx_idle_worker_thread_timeout.info: The number of seconds after which idle worker threads are terminated. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

mysqlx_max_allowed_packet.name: mysqlx_max_allowed_packet
mysqlx_max_allowed_packet.info: The maximum size of network packets that can be received by X Plugin. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

mysqlx_max_connections.name: mysqlx_max_connections
mysqlx_max_connections.info: The maximum number of concurrent client connections X Plugin can accept. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

mysqlx_min_worker_threads.name: mysqlx_min_worker_threads
mysqlx_min_worker_threads.info: The minimum number of worker threads used by X Plugin for handling client requests. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

performance_schema_show_processlist.name: performance_schema_show_processlist
performance_schema_show_processlist.info: The variable determines which SHOW PROCESSLIST implementation to use. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

query_alloc_block_size.name: query_alloc_block_size
query_alloc_block_size.info: The allocation size in bytes of memory blocks that are allocated for objects created during statement parsing and execution. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

query_prealloc_size.name: query_prealloc_size
query_prealloc_size.info: The size in bytes of the persistent buffer used for statement parsing and execution. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

slow_query_log.name: slow_query_log
slow_query_log.info: Whether the slow query log is enabled. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

slow_query_log_file.name: slow_query_log_file
slow_query_log_file.info: The name of the slow query log file. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

sort_buffer_size.name: sort_buffer_size
sort_buffer_size.info: Each session that must perform a sort allocates a buffer of this size. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

sql_buffer_result.name: sql_buffer_result
sql_buffer_result.info: If enabled, sql_buffer_result forces results from SELECT statements to be put into temporary tables. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

binlog_cache_size.name: binlog_cache_size
binlog_cache_size.info: binlog_cache_size sets the size for the transaction cache only. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

binlog_direct_non_transactional_updates.name: binlog_direct_non_transactional_updates
binlog_direct_non_transactional_updates.info: Enabling binlog_direct_non_transactional_updates causes updates to nontransactional tables to be written directly to the binary log, rather than to the transaction cache. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

binlog_error_action.name: binlog_error_action
binlog_error_action.info: Controls what happens when the server encounters an error. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

binlog_group_commit_sync_delay.name: binlog_group_commit_sync_delay
binlog_group_commit_sync_delay.info: Controls how many microseconds the binary log commit waits before synchronizing the binary log file to disk. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

binlog_group_commit_sync_no_delay_count.name: binlog_group_commit_sync_no_delay_count
binlog_group_commit_sync_no_delay_count.info: The maximum number of transactions to wait for before aborting the current delay as specified by binlog_group_commit_sync_delay. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

binlog_max_flush_queue_time.name: binlog_max_flush_queue_time
binlog_max_flush_queue_time.info: This variable no longer has any effect. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

binlog_order_commits.name: binlog_order_commits
binlog_order_commits.info: When this variable is enabled on a replication source server, transaction commit instructions issued to storage engines are serialized on a single thread. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

binlog_stmt_cache_size.name: binlog_stmt_cache_size
binlog_stmt_cache_size.info: This variable determines the size of the cache for the binary log to hold nontransactional statements issued during a transaction. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

binlog_transaction_dependency_history_si.name: binlog_transaction_dependency_history_size
binlog_transaction_dependency_history_si.info: Sets an upper limit on the number of row hashes which are kept in memory and used for looking up the transaction that last modified a given row. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

binlog_transaction_dependency_tracking.name: binlog_transaction_dependency_tracking
binlog_transaction_dependency_tracking.info: The source of dependency information that the source uses to determine which transactions can be executed in parallel by the replica's multithreaded applier. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

expire_logs_days.name: expire_logs_days
expire_logs_days.info: The number of days for automatic binary log file removal. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_flush_log_at_timeout.name: innodb_flush_log_at_timeout
innodb_flush_log_at_timeout.info: Write and flush the logs every N seconds. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit.name: innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit
innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit.info: Controls the balance between strict ACID compliance for commit operations and higher performance. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_log_checkpoint_now.name: innodb_log_checkpoint_now
innodb_log_checkpoint_now.info: Enable this debug option to force InnoDB to write a checkpoint. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_log_checksums.name: innodb_log_checksums
innodb_log_checksums.info: Enables or disables checksums for redo log pages. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_log_compressed_pages.name: innodb_log_compressed_pages
innodb_log_compressed_pages.info: Specifies whether images of re-compressed pages are written to the redo log. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_log_write_ahead_size.name: innodb_log_write_ahead_size
innodb_log_write_ahead_size.info: Defines the write-ahead block size for the redo log, in bytes. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_max_undo_log_size.name: innodb_max_undo_log_size
innodb_max_undo_log_size.info: Defines a threshold size for undo tablespaces. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_online_alter_log_max_size.name: innodb_online_alter_log_max_size
innodb_online_alter_log_max_size.info: Specifies an upper limit in bytes on the size of the temporary log files used during online DDL operations for InnoDB tables. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_undo_log_truncate.name: innodb_undo_log_truncate
innodb_undo_log_truncate.info: When enabled, undo tablespaces that exceed the threshold value defined by innodb_max_undo_log_size are marked for truncation. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_undo_logs.name: innodb_undo_logs
innodb_undo_logs.info: Defines the number of rollback segments used by InnoDB. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

log_bin_trust_function_creators.name: log_bin_trust_function_creators
log_bin_trust_function_creators.info: It controls whether stored function creators can be trusted not to create stored functions that causes unsafe events to be written to the binary log. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

log_bin_use_v1_row_events.name: log_bin_use_v1_row_events
log_bin_use_v1_row_events.info: Whether Version 2 binary logging is in use. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

log_builtin_as_identified_by_password.name: log_builtin_as_identified_by_password
log_builtin_as_identified_by_password.info: This variable affects binary logging of user-management statements. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

max_binlog_cache_size.name: max_binlog_cache_size
max_binlog_cache_size.info: If a transaction requires more than this many bytes, the server generates a Multi-statement transaction required more than 'max_binlog_cache_size' bytes of storage error. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

max_binlog_size.name: max_binlog_size
max_binlog_size.info: If a write to the binary log causes the current log file size to exceed the value of this variable, the server rotates the binary logs. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

max_binlog_stmt_cache_size.name: max_binlog_stmt_cache_size
max_binlog_stmt_cache_size.info: If nontransactional statements within a transaction require more than this many bytes of memory, the server generates an error. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

max_relay_log_size.name: max_relay_log_size
max_relay_log_size.info: The size at which the server rotates relay log files automatically. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

relay_log_info_repository.name: relay_log_info_repository
relay_log_info_repository.info: The setting of this variable determines whether the replica server stores its applier metadata repository as an InnoDB table in the mysql system database, or as a file in the data directory. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

relay_log_purge.name: relay_log_purge
relay_log_purge.info: Disables or enables automatic purging of relay log files as soon as they are not needed any more. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

sync_binlog.name: sync_binlog
sync_binlog.info: Controls how often the MySQL server synchronizes the binary log to disk. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

sync_relay_log.name: sync_relay_log
sync_relay_log.info: If the value of this variable is greater than 0, the MySQL server synchronizes its relay log to disk after every sync_relay_log events are written to the relay log. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

sync_relay_log_info.name: sync_relay_log_info
sync_relay_log_info.info: Setting this variable takes effect for all replication channels immediately, including running channels. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_deadlock_detect.name: innodb_deadlock_detect
innodb_deadlock_detect.info: This option is used to disable deadlock detection. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_lock_wait_timeout.name: innodb_lock_wait_timeout
innodb_lock_wait_timeout.info: The length of time in seconds an InnoDB transaction waits for a row lock before giving up. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_print_all_deadlocks.name: innodb_print_all_deadlocks
innodb_print_all_deadlocks.info: When this option is enabled, information about all deadlocks in InnoDB user transactions is recorded in the mysqld error log. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_table_locks.name: innodb_table_locks
innodb_table_locks.info: The default value is 1, which means that LOCK TABLES causes InnoDB to lock a table internally if autocommit = 0. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

max_write_lock_count.name: max_write_lock_count
max_write_lock_count.info: if max_write_lock_count is set to some low value (say, 10), read lock requests may be preferred over pending write lock requests if the read lock requests have already been passed over in favor of 10 write lock requests. Merely simulates MySQL 5.7.

innodb_read_only.name: innodb_read_only
innodb_read_only.info: Starts InnoDB in read-only mode. For distributing database applications or data sets on read-only media. Can also be used in data warehouses to share the same data directory between multiple instances, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

innodb_api_disable_rowlock.name: innodb_api_disable_rowlock
innodb_api_disable_rowlock.info: Use this option to disable row locks when InnoDB memcached performs DML operations. By default, innodb_api_disable_rowlock is disabled, which means that memcached requests row locks for get and set operations, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

innodb_autoinc_lock_mode.name: innodb_autoinc_lock_mode
innodb_autoinc_lock_mode.info: The lock mode to use for generating auto-increment values. Permissible values are 0, 1, or 2, for traditional, consecutive, or interleaved, respectively. The default setting is 1 (consecutive), merely simulates MySQL 5.7

skip_external_locking.name: skip_external_locking
skip_external_locking.info: This is OFF if mysqld uses external locking (system locking), ON if external locking is disabled, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

super_read_only.name: super_read_only
super_read_only.info: If the read_only system variable is enabled, the server permits no client updates except from users who have the SUPER privilege.
