If the super_read_only system variable is also enabled, the server prohibits client updates even from users who have SUPER, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

event_scheduler.name: event_scheduler
event_scheduler.info: Whether the MySQL Event Scheduler is enabled.

plsql_optimize_level.name: plsql_optimize_level
plsql_optimize_level.info: PLSQL_OPTIMIZE_LEVEL specifies the optimization level that will be used to compile PL/SQL library units. The higher the setting of this parameter, the more effort the compiler makes to optimize PL/SQL library units.

group_replication_group_seeds.name: group_replication_group_seeds
group_replication_group_seeds.info: A list of group members to which a joining member can connect to obtain details of all the current group members

slave_rows_search_algorithms.name: slave_rows_search_algorithms
slave_rows_search_algorithms.info: When preparing batches of rows for row-based logging and replication, this variable controls how the rows are searched for matches

slave_type_conversions.name: slave_type_conversions
slave_type_conversions.info: Controls the type conversion mode in effect on the replica when using row-based replication
slave_type_conversions.ref_url: Controls the type conversion mode in effect on the replica when using row-based replication

ob_hnsw_ef_search.name: ob_hnsw_ef_search
ob_hnsw_ef_search.info: The number of neighbor nodes considered during any HNSW vector index search on the session

delay_key_write.name: delay_key_write
delay_key_write.info: This variable specifies how to use delayed key writes. It applies only to MyISAM tables. Delayed key writing causes key buffers not to be flushed between writes, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

innodb_large_prefix.name: innodb_large_prefix
innodb_large_prefix.info: When this option is enabled, index key prefixes longer than 767 bytes (up to 3072 bytes) are allowed for InnoDB tables that use DYNAMIC or COMPRESSED row format, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

key_buffer_size.name: key_buffer_size
key_buffer_size.info: The size of the buffer used for index blocks, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

key_cache_age_threshold.name: key_cache_age_threshold
key_cache_age_threshold.info: This value controls the demotion of buffers from the hot sublist of a key cache to the warm sublist. Lower values cause demotion to happen more quickly, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

key_cache_division_limit.name: key_cache_division_limit
key_cache_division_limit.info: The division point between the hot and warm sublists of the key cache buffer list, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

max_seeks_for_key.name: max_seeks_for_key
max_seeks_for_key.info: Limit the assumed maximum number of seeks when looking up rows based on a key, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

old_alter_table.name: old_alter_table
old_alter_table.info: When this variable is enabled, the server does not use the optimized method of processing an ALTER TABLE operation, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

table_definition_cache.name: table_definition_cache
table_definition_cache.info: The number of table definitions that can be stored in the table definition cache, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

innodb_sort_buffer_size.name: innodb_sort_buffer_size
innodb_sort_buffer_size.info: The sort buffer size for online DDL operations that create or rebuild secondary indexes, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

key_cache_block_size.name: key_cache_block_size
key_cache_block_size.info: The size in bytes of blocks in the key cache, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

ob_kv_mode.name: ob_kv_mode
ob_kv_mode.info: Use this variable to select the interface mode for the OBKV tenant. You can select one of 'ALL, TABLEAPI, HBASE, REDIS, NONE', where 'ALL' is the default and 'NONE' represents the non-OBKV interface mode.

__ob_client_capability_flag.name: __ob_client_capability_flag
__ob_client_capability_flag.info: Indicate features that observer supports, readonly after modified by first observer
__ob_client_capability_flag.info_cn: Negotiation mark between server and client

character_sets_dir.name: character_sets_dir
character_sets_dir.info: The directory where character sets are installed

disconnect_on_expired_password.name: disconnect_on_expired_password
disconnect_on_expired_password.info: This variable controls how the server handles clients with expired passwords

external_user.name: external_user
external_user.info: The external user name used during the authentication process, as set by the plugin used to authenticate the client

have_crypt.name: have_crypt
have_crypt.info: The external user name used during the authentication process, as set by the plugin used to authenticate the client

have_dynamic_loading.name: have_dynamic_loading
have_dynamic_loading.info: YES if mysqld supports dynamic loading of plugins, NO if not. If the value is NO, you cannot use options such as --plugin-load to load plugins at server startup, or the INSTALL PLUGIN statement to load plugins at runtime

keyring_aws_conf_file.name: keyring_aws_conf_file
keyring_aws_conf_file.info: The location of the configuration file for the keyring_aws plugin. This variable is unavailable unless that plugin is installed

keyring_aws_data_file.name: keyring_aws_data_file
keyring_aws_data_file.info: The location of the storage file for the keyring_aws plugin. This variable is unavailable unless that plugin is installed

language.name: language
language.info: The language to use for error messages

lc_messages_dir.name: lc_messages_dir
lc_messages_dir.info: The language to use for error messages

lower_case_file_system.name: lower_case_file_system
lower_case_file_system.info: This variable describes the case sensitivity of file names on the file system where the data directory is located

max_digest_length.name: max_digest_length
max_digest_length.info: The maximum number of bytes of memory reserved per session for computation of normalized statement digests

ndbinfo_database.name: ndbinfo_database
ndbinfo_database.info: Shows the name used for the NDB information database

ndbinfo_table_prefix.name: ndbinfo_table_prefix
ndbinfo_table_prefix.info: The prefix used in naming the ndbinfo database's base tables (normally hidden, unless exposed by setting ndbinfo_show_hidden

ndbinfo_version.name: ndbinfo_version
ndbinfo_version.info: Shows the version of the ndbinfo engine in use

ndb_batch_size.name: ndb_batch_size
ndb_batch_size.info: This sets the size in bytes that is used for NDB transaction batches

ndb_cluster_connection_pool.name: ndb_cluster_connection_pool
ndb_cluster_connection_pool.info: a mysqld process can use multiple connections to the cluster, effectively mimicking several SQL nodes

ndb_cluster_connection_pool_nodeids.name: ndb_cluster_connection_pool_nodeids
ndb_cluster_connection_pool_nodeids.info: Specifies a comma-separated list of node IDs for connections to the cluster used by an SQL node

ndb_log_apply_status.name: ndb_log_apply_status
ndb_log_apply_status.info: Causes a replica mysqld to log any updates received from its immediate source to the mysql.ndb_apply_status table in its own binary log using its own server ID rather than the server ID of the source

ndb_log_bin.name: ndb_log_bin
ndb_log_bin.info: Causes updates to NDB tables to be written to the binary log. Setting this variable has no effect if binary logging is not already enabled for the server using log_bin

ndb_log_fail_terminate.name: ndb_log_fail_terminate
ndb_log_fail_terminate.info: When this option is specified, and complete logging of all found row events is not possible, the mysqld process is terminated

ndb_log_orig.name: ndb_log_orig
ndb_log_orig.info: Shows whether the originating server ID and epoch are logged in the ndb_binlog_index table

ndb_log_transaction_id.name: ndb_log_transaction_id
ndb_log_transaction_id.info: shows whether a replica mysqld writes NDB transaction IDs in the binary log

Ndb_system_name.name: Ndb_system_name
Ndb_system_name.info: If this MySQL Server is connected to an NDB cluster, this read-only variable shows the cluster system name. Otherwise, the value is an empty string

ndb_use_copying_alter_table.name: ndb_use_copying_alter_table
ndb_use_copying_alter_table.info: Forces NDB to use copying of tables in the event of problems with online ALTER TABLE operations

ndb_version_string.name: ndb_version_string
ndb_version_string.info: NDB engine version in ndb-x.y.z format

ndb_wait_connected.name: ndb_wait_connected
ndb_wait_connected.info: This option sets the period of time that the MySQL server waits for connections to NDB Cluster management and data nodes to be established before accepting MySQL client connections.

ndb_wait_setup.name: ndb_wait_setup
ndb_wait_setup.info: This variable shows the period of time that the MySQL server waits for the NDB storage engine to complete setup before timing out and treating NDB as unavailable. The time is specified in seconds.

proxy_user.name: proxy_user
proxy_user.info: If the current client is a proxy for another user, this variable is the proxy user account name

sha256_password_auto_generate_rsa_keys.name: sha256_password_auto_generate_rsa_keys
sha256_password_auto_generate_rsa_keys.info: It controls whether the server autogenerates RSA private/public key-pair files in the data directory

sha256_password_private_key_path.name: sha256_password_private_key_path
sha256_password_private_key_path.info: Its value is the path name of the RSA private key file for the sha256_password authentication plugin

sha256_password_public_key_path.name: sha256_password_public_key_path
sha256_password_public_key_path.info: Its value is the path name of the RSA public key file for the sha256_password authentication plugin

skip_show_database.name: skip_show_database
skip_show_database.info: If the variable value is ON, the SHOW DATABASES statement is permitted only to users who have the SHOW DATABASES privilege, and the statement displays all database names

plugin_load.name: plugin_load
plugin_load.info: This option tells the server to load the named plugins at startup

plugin_load_add.name: plugin_load_add
plugin_load_add.info: adds a plugin or plugins to the set of plugins to be loaded at startup

big_tables.name: big_tables
big_tables.info: the server stores all temporary tables on disk rather than in memory

check_proxy_users.name: check_proxy_users
check_proxy_users.info: If the check_proxy_users system variable is enabled, the server performs proxy user mapping for any authentication plugins that make such a request

connection_control_failed_connections_th.name: connection_control_failed_connections_threshold
connection_control_failed_connections_th.info: The number of consecutive failed connection attempts permitted to accounts before the server adds a delay for subsequent connection attempts

connection_control_max_connection_delay.name: connection_control_max_connection_delay
connection_control_max_connection_delay.info: The maximum delay in milliseconds for server response to failed connection attempts, if connection_control_failed_connections_threshold is greater than zero

connection_control_min_connection_delay.name: connection_control_min_connection_delay
connection_control_min_connection_delay.info: The minmum delay in milliseconds for server response to failed connection attempts, if connection_control_failed_connections_threshold is greater than zero

default_week_format.name: default_week_format
default_week_format.info: The default mode value to use for the WEEK() function

eq_range_index_dive_limit.name: eq_range_index_dive_limit
eq_range_index_dive_limit.info: This variable indicates the number of equality ranges in an equality comparison condition when the optimizer should switch from using index dives to index statistics in estimating the number of qualifying rows

innodb_stats_auto_recalc.name: innodb_stats_auto_recalc
innodb_stats_auto_recalc.info: Causes InnoDB to automatically recalculate persistent statistics after the data in a table is changed substantially, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

innodb_stats_include_delete_marked.name: innodb_stats_include_delete_marked
innodb_stats_include_delete_marked.info: When innodb_stats_include_delete_marked is enabled, ANALYZE TABLE considers delete-marked records when recalculating statistics

innodb_stats_method.name: innodb_stats_method
innodb_stats_method.info: How the server treats NULL values when collecting statistics about the distribution of index values for InnoDB tables

innodb_stats_on_metadata.name: innodb_stats_on_metadata
innodb_stats_on_metadata.info: When innodb_stats_on_metadata is enabled, InnoDB updates non-persistent statistics when metadata statements such as SHOW TABLE STATUS or when accessing the Information Schema TABLES or STATISTICS tables

version_tokens_session.name: version_tokens_session
version_tokens_session.info: The session value of this variable specifies the client version token list and indicates the tokens that the client session requires the server version token list to have, merely simulates MySQL 5.7

innodb_stats_persistent_sample_pages.name: innodb_stats_persistent_sample_pages
innodb_stats_persistent_sample_pages.info: The number of index pages to sample when estimating cardinality and other statistics for an indexed column, such as those calculated by ANALYZE TABLE

innodb_stats_sample_pages.name: innodb_stats_sample_pages
innodb_stats_sample_pages.info: The number of index pages to sample when estimating cardinality and other statistics for an indexed column, such as those calculated by ANALYZE TABLE

innodb_stats_transient_sample_pages.name: innodb_stats_transient_sample_pages
innodb_stats_transient_sample_pages.info: The number of index pages to sample when estimating cardinality and other statistics for an indexed column, such as those calculated by ANALYZE TABLE

keyring_aws_cmk_id.name: keyring_aws_cmk_id
keyring_aws_cmk_id.info: The customer master key (CMK) ID obtained from the AWS KMS server and used by the keyring_aws plugin

keyring_aws_region.name: keyring_aws_region
keyring_aws_region.info: The AWS region for the keyring_aws plugin. This variable is unavailable unless that plugin is installed

keyring_encrypted_file_data.name: keyring_encrypted_file_data
keyring_encrypted_file_data.info: The path name of the data file used for secure data storage by the keyring_encrypted_file plugin

keyring_encrypted_file_password.name: keyring_encrypted_file_password
keyring_encrypted_file_password.info: The password used by the keyring_encrypted_file pluginn

keyring_file_data.name: keyring_file_data
keyring_file_data.info: The path name of the data file used for secure data storage by the keyring_file plugin

keyring_okv_conf_dir.name: keyring_okv_conf_dir
keyring_okv_conf_dir.info: The path name of the directory that stores configuration information used by the keyring_okv plugin

keyring_operations.name: keyring_operations
keyring_operations.info: Whether keyring operations are enabled. This variable is used during key migration operations

max_connect_errors.name: max_connect_errors
max_connect_errors.info: After max_connect_errors successive connection requests from a host are interrupted without a successful connection, the server blocks that host from further connections

mysql_firewall_mode.name: mysql_firewall_mode
mysql_firewall_mode.info: Whether MySQL Enterprise Firewall is enabled (the default) or disabled

mysql_firewall_trace.name: mysql_firewall_trace
mysql_firewall_trace.info: Whether the MySQL Enterprise Firewall trace is enabled or disabled (the default)

mysql_native_password_proxy_users.name: mysql_native_password_proxy_users
mysql_native_password_proxy_users.info: This variable controls whether the mysql_native_password built-in authentication plugin supports proxy users

net_retry_count.name: net_retry_count
net_retry_count.info: If a read or write on a communication port is interrupted, retry this many times before giving up. This value should be set quite high on FreeBSD because internal interrupts are sent to all threads

new.name: new
new.info: This variable was used in MySQL 4.0 to turn on some 4.1 behaviors, and is retained for backward compatibility. Its value is always OFF

old_passwords.name: old_passwords
old_passwords.info: This variable controls the password hashing method used by the PASSWORD() function. It also influences password hashing performed by CREATE USER and GRANT statements that specify a password using an IDENTIFIED BY clause

optimizer_prune_level.name: optimizer_prune_level
optimizer_prune_level.info: Controls the heuristics applied during query optimization to prune less-promising partial plans from the optimizer search space

optimizer_search_depth.name: optimizer_search_depth
optimizer_search_depth.info: The maximum depth of search performed by the query optimizer

optimizer_trace_features.name: optimizer_trace_features
optimizer_trace_features.info: This variable enables or disables selected optimizer tracing features

optimizer_trace_limit.name: optimizer_trace_limit
optimizer_trace_limit.info: The maximum number of optimizer traces to display

optimizer_trace_max_mem_size.name: optimizer_trace_max_mem_size
optimizer_trace_max_mem_size.info: The maximum cumulative size of stored optimizer traces

optimizer_trace_offset.name: optimizer_trace_offset
optimizer_trace_offset.info: The offset of optimizer traces to display

parser_max_mem_size.name: parser_max_mem_size
parser_max_mem_size.info: The maximum amount of memory available to the parser

rand_seed1.name: rand_seed1
rand_seed1.info: For statements that invoke RAND(), the source passes two values to the replica, where they are used to seed the random number generator

rand_seed2.name: rand_seed2
rand_seed2.info: For statements that invoke RAND(), the source passes two values to the replica, where they are used to seed the random number generator

range_alloc_block_size.name: range_alloc_block_size
range_alloc_block_size.info: The size in bytes of blocks that are allocated when doing range optimization

range_optimizer_max_mem_size.name: range_optimizer_max_mem_size
range_optimizer_max_mem_size.info: The limit on memory consumption for the range optimizer

rewriter_enabled.name: rewriter_enabled
rewriter_enabled.info: Whether the Rewriter query rewrite plugin is enabled

secure_auth.name: secure_auth
secure_auth.info: If this variable is enabled, the server blocks connections by clients that attempt to use accounts that have passwords stored in the old (pre-4.1) format

sha256_password_proxy_users.name: sha256_password_proxy_users
sha256_password_proxy_users.info: This variable controls whether the sha256_password built-in authentication plugin supports proxy users

show_compatibility_56.name: show_compatibility_56
show_compatibility_56.info: which affects whether MySQL 5.6 compatibility is enabled with respect to how system and status variable information is provided by the INFORMATION_SCHEMA and Performance Schema tables, and also by the SHOW VARIABLES and SHOW STATUS statements

show_create_table_verbosity.name: show_create_table_verbosity
show_create_table_verbosity.info: Enabling this variable causes SHOW CREATE TABLE to display ROW_FORMAT regardless of whether it is the default format

show_old_temporals.name: show_old_temporals
show_old_temporals.info: Whether SHOW CREATE TABLE output includes comments

sql_big_selects.name: sql_big_selects
sql_big_selects.info: If set to OFF, MySQL aborts SELECT statements that are likely to take a very long time to execute

updatable_views_with_limit.name: updatable_views_with_limit
updatable_views_with_limit.info: This variable controls whether updates to a view can be made when the view does not contain all columns of the primary key defined in the underlying table, if the update statement contains a LIMIT clause

validate_password_dictionary_file.name: validate_password_dictionary_file
validate_password_dictionary_file.info: The path name of the dictionary file that validate_password uses for checking passwords.

ndb_version.name: ndb_version
ndb_version.info: NDB engine version in ndb-x.y.z format

auto_generate_certs.name: auto_generate_certs
auto_generate_certs.info: This variable is available if the server was compiled using OpenSSL. It controls whether the server autogenerates SSL key and certificate files in the data directory, if they do not already exist

range_index_dive_limit.name: range_index_dive_limit
range_index_dive_limit.info: Indicate the limit on the number of ranges when optimizer use storage cardinality estimation

partition_index_dive_limit.name: partition_index_dive_limit
partition_index_dive_limit.info: Indicate the limit on the number of partitions when optimizer use storage cardinality estimation

ob_table_access_policy.name: ob_table_access_policy
ob_table_access_policy.info: Control the optimizer to generate a table access plan that prefers a specific storage format.

pid_file.name: pid_file
pid_file.info: The path name of the file in which the server writes its process ID

port.name: port
port.info: The number of the port on which the server listens for TCP/IP connections

socket.name: socket
socket.info: the name of the socket file that is used for local client connections

mview_refresh_dop.name: mview_refresh_dop
mview_refresh_dop.info: The default refresh parallelism of materialized view

enable_optimizer_rowgoal.name: enable_optimizer_rowgoal
enable_optimizer_rowgoal.info: Control whether the optimizer considers the impact of rowgoal (such as the LIMIT operator, etc.) during cardinality estimation.
enable_optimizer_rowgoal.info_cn: 控制优化器在基数估计时是否考虑行数目标（如 LIMIT 算子等）的影响

ob_ivf_nprobes.name: ob_ivf_nprobes
ob_ivf_nprobes.info: The number of nearest cluster centers from the IVF vector index searched during this session.
